intro: Sidalcea tenella, commonly known as the narrowleaf checker-mallow, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. The plant has slender, branching stems and produces small, showy pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a distinctive hairy texture. Sidalcea tenella is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is known for its ecological importance to native pollinators.
